meta_description: Champaign Aviation Museum; Active B-17 restoration museum with historic aircraft B-25, C-47, A-26, and many more!
admission_text:
######    
14th Annual Gala  
Saturday, May 2nd, 2026

Join us on Saturday, May 2nd, 2026 for the 

Champaign Aviation Museum's 14th Annual Gala! 

Doors open at 5:30pm and activities of the evening include complimentary drinks and light appetizers, Musical Guest

Ellis Jae Williams, fly-by (weather permitting), a delicious dinner and dessert, silent auction throughout the evening, and Keynote Speaker Captain Ronald A. McGee.

​

​

​​​​

Ronald McGee was born on September 6, 1948 in Columbus, Ohio. After earning his Bachelor of Science Degree in Aerospace Engineering, he completed the ROTC program in 1970 and was awarded the Flying Tiger Award as the best pilot in the program. He then entered the Air Force Pilot Training program at Laredo, Texas where he ranked number 3 of 63 in his graduating class. (Ronald continued the legacy of his father, Charles E. McGee, a Documented Original Tuskegee Airmen. His father, Brigadier General Charles McGee fought in WWII, Korea, and Vietnam and holds the record as the only Air Force pilot to fly more than 100 combat sorties in all three wars). ​​

​

Captain McGee became one of the top F-4 pilots at George Air Force Base, CA. From September 1972 to 1973, he went to Vietnam and was stationed at Ubon Royal Thai Air Base in Thailand, flying F-4 Phantoms with the famed “Night Owl” 497th Tactical Fighter Squadron. In 1973 he returned to the States and was stationed at Bergstrom Air Force Base, TX. In 1977 he separated from the Air Force and we...
collections_text:
# CHAMPAIGN AVIATION MUSEUM

We are a 501 c (3) non-profit  dedicated to preserving aviation history for current and future generations.

[GET INVOLVED](https://www.champaignaviationmuseum.org/getinvolved)

1

Mission

8

### Vintage Aircraft

100+

### Volunteers

1000+

Stories

## About Champaign Aviation Museum

Originally started in 2005 with three flatbeds of parts and pieces of several B-17s, we have grown to become a center of excellence for B-17 restoration. Click the link below to learn more about our journey.

[Learn More](https://www.champaignaviationmuseum.org/about)

### Event Calendar

Events happening at the Champaign Aviation Museum and air show appearances with the 

B-25 Champaign Gal. Click the link below for a complete listing of CAM events.

​

​

​

[Upcoming Events](https://www.champaignaviationmuseum.org/eventcalendar)

## HOW YOU CAN HELP

To keep our restoration going we need more than just money. We need volunteers, tools, and parts.

[Things We Need](https://www.champaignaviationmuseum.org/getinvolved)

## 2026 Gala

Join us on Saturday, May 2nd for our 14th Annual Gala with Keynote Speaker, Captain Ronald McGee, F-4 Phantom pilot during the Vietnam War and son of Documented Original Tuskegee Airmen, Brigadier General Charles McGee.

[Buy Gala Tickets](https://www.champaignaviationmuseum.org/gala)

## Get to Know Our Aircraft

Want to hear about the stories of our aircraft? Curious where they came from? Check out the link below to find out more.
